title: pbies
author: pbies
content: Which wallet apps for Windows desktop provide:1. downloading whole blockchain2. importing many private keys to wallet (from file or other way)?

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Don't have any experiences running Ethereum nodes/client, but what you should do is to run Execution Clients, that's the term here not in-built wallet with nodes.For various recommended references about execution client nodes, take a look at: https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/nodes-and-clients/#execution-clients.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Quote from: pbies on April 28, 2023, 02:49:52 AMWhich wallet apps for Windows desktop provide:1. downloading whole blockchain2. importing many private keys to wallet (from file or other way)?If it's a desktop app then I think you may check Mycrypto. I've used it before and the developers of it were also developers of MEW. By the way, why you don't just want to use MEW? It's allowing you also to import PKs if you've got the file. I'm not sure if I do understand correctly about the #2. But both wallets, I've mentioned allows you to do the #2 but MEW isn't a desktop but a webwallet.
